title: 1. Booking by Phone
en: You can call the clinic to book an appointment with a doctor

title: 2. Booking Online
en: Many clinics allow online booking through their website or app

title: 3. Booking at Reception
en: You can also book directly by visiting the reception desk

title: Bulk-Billing with Medicare
en: Some clinics offer bulk-billing meaning no payment if you have a Medicare card

title: 4. Arriving on Time
en: Arrive at least 10 minutes early to check in

title: 5. Talking to Receptionist
en: Tell the receptionist your name and appointment time

title: 6. Doctor Consultation
en: Explain your symptoms clearly to the doctor

title: 7. Interpreter Support
en: You can request a free interpreter if you donâ€™t speak English well

title: 8. Prescriptions
en: Doctors may give you a prescription to buy medicine at a pharmacy

title: 9. Follow-up Appointments
en: Sometimes you need to book another appointment for follow-up

title: 10. Bringing Medicare Card
en: Always bring your Medicare card or ID for registration

title: 11. Private vs Public Clinics
en: Private clinics may charge higher fees than public ones

title: 12. Specialist Referrals
en: GPs may refer you to a specialist if needed

title: 13. Telehealth Consultations
en: Some doctors offer video or phone consultations

title: 14. Emergency vs Non-Emergency
en: For emergencies call 000 or go to hospital not GP clinic

title: 15. After-Hours Clinics
en: Some clinics open late or on weekends for after-hours care

title: 16. Medical Certificates
en: Doctors can issue certificates for work or school absence

title: 17. Confidentiality and Privacy
en: Doctors must keep your medical information private.

title: 18. Bringing Medical History
en: Bring past medical records if you have them.
